segment.source: MD Maintain Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Maintain Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Maintain Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Maintain Microsoft Intune

segment.source: As a cloud service hosted by Microsoft, the service is maintained automatically with little maintenance required by you.
segment.target: As a cloud service hosted by Microsoft, the service is maintained automatically with little maintenance required by you.

segment.source: However, you should be familiar with the following maintenance tasks that might be required to maintain your service:
segment.target: However, you should be familiar with the following maintenance tasks that might be required to maintain your service:

segment.source: Common maintenance tasks
segment.target: Common maintenance tasks

segment.source: Change your contact preferences
segment.target: Change your contact preferences

segment.source: Manage partner relationships
segment.target: Manage partner relationships

segment.source: Decommission your subscription
segment.target: Decommission your subscription

segment.source: Common maintenance tasks
segment.target: Common maintenance tasks

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Update the service
segment.target: Update the service

segment.source: is a cloud service, and Microsoft manages service updates for you.
segment.target: is a cloud service, and Microsoft manages service updates for you.

segment.source: Each time you connect to an administrative web portal, you connect to the most current version available.
segment.target: Each time you connect to an administrative web portal, you connect to the most current version available.

segment.source: Typically, service updates do not cause a visible change.
segment.target: Typically, service updates do not cause a visible change.

segment.source: However, important updates are detailed in the Notice board, which is displayed when you connect to the after a service update.
segment.target: However, important updates are detailed in the Notice board, which is displayed when you connect to the after a service update.

segment.source: You can also view notices on the Notice page of the Alerts workspace of the .
segment.target: You can also view notices on the Notice page of the Alerts workspace of the .

segment.source: When there are updates to the client software, you might be prompted to download and deploy the updated client.
segment.target: When there are updates to the client software, you might be prompted to download and deploy the updated client.

segment.source: See Microsoft Intune Service Updates.
segment.target: See Microsoft Intune Service Updates.

segment.source: Back up and recover data in the cloud
segment.target: Back up and recover data in the cloud

segment.source: As part of the service, the infrastructure and data that is managed for you includes configurations you make for your instance of, data and status from the devices you manage, data you upload to the cloud storage, such as software you deploy and license information, and user accounts that you add to your instance of Microsoft Azure AD.
segment.target: As part of the service, the infrastructure and data that is managed for you includes configurations you make for your instance of, data and status from the devices you manage, data you upload to the cloud storage, such as software you deploy and license information, and user accounts that you add to your instance of Microsoft Azure AD.

segment.source: Data you upload for use with is maintained in the cloud but does not replace the need to maintain an on-premises backup for the source of that information.
segment.target: Data you upload for use with is maintained in the cloud but does not replace the need to maintain an on-premises backup for the source of that information.

segment.source: For information about how Microsoft manages your data, download the Microsoft Intune Privacy and Data Protection Overview white paper.
segment.target: For information about how Microsoft manages your data, download the Microsoft Intune Privacy and Data Protection Overview white paper.

segment.source: Reinstall the On-Premises Exchange Connector
segment.target: Reinstall the On-Premises Exchange Connector

segment.source: There are no options to back up or restore this connector.
segment.target: There are no options to back up or restore this connector.

segment.source: When you install or reinstall this connector, the new instance replaces any previously configured connector.
segment.target: When you install or reinstall this connector, the new instance replaces any previously configured connector.

segment.source: Reinstall the Service to Service Connector
segment.target: Reinstall the Service to Service Connector

segment.source: The configuration of this connector is maintained in your cloud storage and does not require backup or restoration.
segment.target: The configuration of this connector is maintained in your cloud storage and does not require backup or restoration.

segment.source: When you configure this connector, the new instance replaces any previously configured connector.
segment.target: When you configure this connector, the new instance replaces any previously configured connector.

segment.source: Back up individual devices and computers
segment.target: Back up individual devices and computers

segment.source: does not manage the backup or recovery for data, settings, or applications on mobile devices or computers that you manage with the service.
segment.target: does not manage the backup or recovery for data, settings, or applications on mobile devices or computers that you manage with the service.

segment.source: Change your contact preferences
segment.target: Change your contact preferences

segment.source: Administrators for have the option to receive product-related communications from Microsoft:
segment.target: Administrators for have the option to receive product-related communications from Microsoft:

segment.source: To manage the communications you receive:
segment.target: To manage the communications you receive:

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, click Message Center.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, click Message Center.

segment.source: Edit the Contact preferences section to provide your contact details and to select the communications you want to receive.
segment.target: Edit the Contact preferences section to provide your contact details and to select the communications you want to receive.

segment.source: Click Save.
segment.target: Click Save.

segment.source: You will continue to receive email messages related to your billing and service accounts even if you choose not to receive additional product information.
segment.target: You will continue to receive email messages related to your billing and service accounts even if you choose not to receive additional product information.

segment.source: Manage partner relationships
segment.target: Manage partner relationships

segment.source: If you do not currently work with a partner, you can find one on the Microsoft Pinpoint website.
segment.target: If you do not currently work with a partner, you can find one on the Microsoft Pinpoint website.

segment.source: Partner availability depends on the services you use and the country or region where you will use those services.
segment.target: Partner availability depends on the services you use and the country or region where you will use those services.

segment.source: Manage a Partner for your subscription
segment.target: Manage a Partner for your subscription

segment.source: Partners are advisors who can provide sales, support, and technical expertise to help you set up and maintain your subscription.
segment.target: Partners are advisors who can provide sales, support, and technical expertise to help you set up and maintain your subscription.

segment.source: You can add, change, or remove a Microsoft partner from your subscription at any time.
segment.target: You can add, change, or remove a Microsoft partner from your subscription at any time.

segment.source: Before you add or change a partner for your subscription, you must have the partner’s Microsoft Partner ID.
segment.target: Before you add or change a partner for your subscription, you must have the partner’s Microsoft Partner ID.

segment.source: To manage a partner for a subscription:
segment.target: To manage a partner for a subscription:

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, click Manage.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, click Manage.

segment.source: Click .
segment.target: Click .

segment.source: On the Subscription details page, in the right pane under Partner information, click:
segment.target: On the Subscription details page, in the right pane under Partner information, click:

segment.source: Add if you are adding a partner to your subscription.
segment.target: Add if you are adding a partner to your subscription.

segment.source: Edit if you are changing or removing a partner.
segment.target: Edit if you are changing or removing a partner.

segment.source: Update the information for Microsoft partner ID:
segment.target: Update the information for Microsoft partner ID:

segment.source: To add or change a partner, enter the Partner ID of the partner you want to work with.
segment.target: To add or change a partner, enter the Partner ID of the partner you want to work with.

segment.source: To remove a partner, clear the Partner ID
segment.target: To remove a partner, clear the Partner ID

segment.source: Click OK to save the change.
segment.target: Click OK to save the change.

segment.source: Manage a delegated administrator
segment.target: Manage a delegated administrator

segment.source: When you subscribe to , you are given administrator permissions and can assign administrator permissions to other users in your company.
segment.target: When you subscribe to , you are given administrator permissions and can assign administrator permissions to other users in your company.

segment.source: However, when you want someone else to administer the service, you can delegate this role to a Microsoft partner.
segment.target: However, when you want someone else to administer the service, you can delegate this role to a Microsoft partner.

segment.source: When you authorize a partner to take on this role, the partner is referred to as a delegated administrator.
segment.target: When you authorize a partner to take on this role, the partner is referred to as a delegated administrator.

segment.source: Add a delegated administrator: This process must be initiated by your Microsoft partner.
segment.target: Add a delegated administrator: This process must be initiated by your Microsoft partner.

segment.source: The partner sends you an email message asking you if you want to give them permissions to act as a delegated administrator.
segment.target: The partner sends you an email message asking you if you want to give them permissions to act as a delegated administrator.

segment.source: Read the partner's terms in the email message.
segment.target: Read the partner's terms in the email message.

segment.source: To authorize the agreement, click the link provided in the message, which will take you to an authorization page.
segment.target: To authorize the agreement, click the link provided in the message, which will take you to an authorization page.

segment.source: View your delegated administrators:
segment.target: View your delegated administrators:

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, under Support, click Overview.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, under Support, click Overview.

segment.source: On the Support overview page, under Delegated administrators, click Manage your delegated administrators.
segment.target: On the Support overview page, under Delegated administrators, click Manage your delegated administrators.

segment.source: Remove a delegated administrator:
segment.target: Remove a delegated administrator:

segment.source: When you remove a delegated administrator, you remove the partner’s permissions to access and modify your service.
segment.target: When you remove a delegated administrator, you remove the partner’s permissions to access and modify your service.

segment.source: You can remove the delegated partner at any time.
segment.target: You can remove the delegated partner at any time.

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, under Support, click Overview.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune account portal, under Support, click Overview.

segment.source: On the Support overview page, under Delegated administrators, click Manage your delegated administrators.
segment.target: On the Support overview page, under Delegated administrators, click Manage your delegated administrators.

segment.source: On the Delegated administrators page, select the partner that you want to remove and click Remove delegated administrator.
segment.target: On the Delegated administrators page, select the partner that you want to remove and click Remove delegated administrator.

segment.source: Decommission your subscription
segment.target: Decommission your subscription

segment.source: Use the following information to remove data from devices and your infrastructure when you plan to no longer use .
segment.target: Use the following information to remove data from devices and your infrastructure when you plan to no longer use .

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Cancel your subscription
segment.target: Cancel your subscription

segment.source: To cancel your subscription, you must Contact Assisted Phone Support for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To cancel your subscription, you must Contact Assisted Phone Support for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To help protect your privacy, we ask you to provide the following information regarding your account: the work or school account you use to sign in to the cloud service, the first and last name of the primary contact for your organization, the name of your organization as it shows on your account, and the complete street address of your organization.
segment.target: To help protect your privacy, we ask you to provide the following information regarding your account: the work or school account you use to sign in to the cloud service, the first and last name of the primary contact for your organization, the name of your organization as it shows on your account, and the complete street address of your organization.

segment.source: Before you cancel your subscription:
segment.target: Before you cancel your subscription:

segment.source: Remove domains from your cloud service: If you added your own domain names for your organization to use with , you need to Remove a domain.
segment.target: Remove domains from your cloud service: If you added your own domain names for your organization to use with , you need to Remove a domain.

segment.source: Save your data: The data associated with your online service is deleted 90 days after you cancel your subscription.
segment.target: Save your data: The data associated with your online service is deleted 90 days after you cancel your subscription.

segment.source: After your subscription is canceled, if you change your mind, you can reinstate your subscription within 90 days by contacting Support by phone.
segment.target: After your subscription is canceled, if you change your mind, you can reinstate your subscription within 90 days by contacting Support by phone.

segment.source: Remove data from devices and computers
segment.target: Remove data from devices and computers

segment.source: When you plan to no longer use the service to manage a device, you might want to uninstall the applications you manage with , remove the app, and uninstall the client software from computers.
segment.target: When you plan to no longer use the service to manage a device, you might want to uninstall the applications you manage with , remove the app, and uninstall the client software from computers.

segment.source: Typically, applications and configurations that are introduced by remain in place after you stop using .
segment.target: Typically, applications and configurations that are introduced by remain in place after you stop using .

segment.source: Therefore, plan to use the built-in options to wipe devices to remove sensitive information, and plan to uninstall applications before ending active management.
segment.target: Therefore, plan to use the built-in options to wipe devices to remove sensitive information, and plan to uninstall applications before ending active management.

segment.source: The process to uninstall applications is app-specific.
segment.target: The process to uninstall applications is app-specific.

segment.source: Be aware that settings previously enforced or set by remain in place on the device.
segment.target: Be aware that settings previously enforced or set by remain in place on the device.

segment.source: When the settings are no longer enforced, they can be changed by the owner of the device.
segment.target: When the settings are no longer enforced, they can be changed by the owner of the device.

segment.source: For information about retiring devices from , see the following topics:
segment.target: For information about retiring devices from , see the following topics:

segment.source: Mobile devices: See Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Mobile devices: See Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Computers: See the "To retire a computer" section in Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.
segment.target: Computers: See the "To retire a computer" section in Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client.

segment.source: Remove infrastructure
segment.target: Remove infrastructure

segment.source: has no common infrastructure or software that you uninstall from your servers.
segment.target: has no common infrastructure or software that you uninstall from your servers.

segment.source: However, the following are examples of optional tools you might use with that you can uninstall when no longer used in your environment:
segment.target: However, the following are examples of optional tools you might use with that you can uninstall when no longer used in your environment:

segment.source: On-Premises Exchange Connector
segment.target: On-Premises Exchange Connector

segment.source: Tools for Active Directory synchronization, including Directory Sync tool, Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0 (AD FS), AD FS 2.0 Proxy, and TThird-party Identity Provider.
segment.target: Tools for Active Directory synchronization, including Directory Sync tool, Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0 (AD FS), AD FS 2.0 Proxy, and TThird-party Identity Provider.

segment.source: Before uninstalling a tool or solution, ensure it is no longer in use.
segment.target: Before uninstalling a tool or solution, ensure it is no longer in use.

segment.source: For example, you might use a solution such as the Active Directory Sync Tool to synchronize your local users with Azure AD.
segment.target: For example, you might use a solution such as the Active Directory Sync Tool to synchronize your local users with Azure AD.

segment.source: If you continue to subscribe to other cloud services like Office 365, you might need to retain the tool for use by that service.
segment.target: If you continue to subscribe to other cloud services like Office 365, you might need to retain the tool for use by that service.

segment.source: Remove data from the cloud
segment.target: Remove data from the cloud

segment.source: When you choose to no longer subscribe to , you can use the and to actively remove information and data you store in the cloud.
segment.target: When you choose to no longer subscribe to , you can use the and to actively remove information and data you store in the cloud.

segment.source: This data can include your user and device information, software you uploaded to deploy to devices, and custom configurations such as groups and reports.
segment.target: This data can include your user and device information, software you uploaded to deploy to devices, and custom configurations such as groups and reports.

segment.source: If you do not remove your data from the cloud before your subscription ends, it enters a 90-day grace period during which you can continue to access and manage your data in .
segment.target: If you do not remove your data from the cloud before your subscription ends, it enters a 90-day grace period during which you can continue to access and manage your data in .

segment.source: However, during this grace period, you cannot manage devices by using the service.
segment.target: However, during this grace period, you cannot manage devices by using the service.

segment.source: After the grace period expires, Microsoft deletes all instances of your data automatically, and that information is no longer available.
segment.target: After the grace period expires, Microsoft deletes all instances of your data automatically, and that information is no longer available.

segment.source: For more information, see “Data disposition” in the Microsoft Intune Privacy and Data Protection Overview white paper.
segment.target: For more information, see “Data disposition” in the Microsoft Intune Privacy and Data Protection Overview white paper.

segment.target: See Also
